title: Taylor McFerrin - Early Riser (2014) [FLAC]
description:
01. Postpartum
02. Degrees of Light
03. The Antidote (Featuring Nai Palm)
04. Florasia
05. 4 am
06. Stepps
07. Already There (Featuring Robert Glasper and Thundercat)
08. Decisions (Featuring Emily King)
09. Blind Aesthetics
10. Place in My Heart (Featuring RYAT)
11. Invisible/Visible (Featuring Bobby McFerrin and Cesar Camargo Mariano)
12. PLS DNT LSTN


Taylor's musical style is equally influenced by the legends of 60s/70s Soul, the kings of the Modern Beat Generation, Golden Era hip hop, free form jazz and electronic music. By playing all of the instruments on his productions, while also relying heavily on sampling and chopping up his live takes, he has found a sound that seamlessly bridges myriad musical worlds and draws the listener into a constantly shifting audio soundscape. 

If McFerrinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own voice on a track like Ã¢â‚¬Å“FlorasiaÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ adds a genuine neo-soul emotion, his guests are sensational. From Nai Palm of Melbourne's Grammy-nominated Hiatus Kaiyote on Ã¢â‚¬Å“The AntidoteÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, through Emily King on Ã¢â‚¬Å“DecisionsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (Ã¢â‚¬Å“one of the best singers alive in my opinionÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬â€œ McFerrin) and on to labelmate RYATÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s collaboration on Ã¢â‚¬Å“Place In My HeartÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, each adds a different mood and lift to the music theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re involved with. TaylorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s father, the legendary Bobby McFerrin, teams up with Brazilian master Cesar Mariano on Ã¢â‚¬Å“Invisible/VisibleÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ for one of the jazziest moments on the record. Robert Glasper, Thundercat and Marcus Gilmore also provide their substantial jazz chops to Ã¢â‚¬Å“Already ThereÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½. But the key to the whole record is the balance which McFerrin keeps throughout Ã¢â‚¬â€œ between his guest's individuality and his own vision, between the styles of music he loves, between a feeling of intense, sunlit joy and a deep aching sadness, which, it could be argued, is a definition of soul.
